attributes.action: Hold a public enquiry into Ministers' personal links to PPE companies.
attributes.additional_details:
Several British businesses have asserted that they attempted to tender for PPE supply early in the Pandemic but received no reply to their offers. 
Contracts with other businesses resulted in faulty, inadequate PPE being supplied at enormous cost.
There seems to be evidence of personal links between some ministers and those who bid successfully and profited greatly, even though they did not supply equipment to the required standard.
This needs urgent and transparent investigation and, if appropriate, public apology and recompense.
attributes.background: Parliament needs to urgently address the issue of 'cronyism' which may have led to the squandering of public funds.
